about_the_game:
It’s New Year's Eve tonight, you know. Calendar says so. Wonder what Benny’s up to these days. Haven’t seen him in ages. Haven’t heard from him neither. Hope he’s alright.

DEMO

Note: This demo offers a preview of the full project. Expected playtime is 20-40 minutes, depending upon how thoroughly the player chooses to explore the world; motivated players will find many details to explore which will help to flesh out the experience.

The following marketing copy is borrowed from the Steam page for the full release. If you find this project interesting, please consider reviewing the game and wishlisting the full release.

DESCRIPTION

Fourth Time Around is an experimental walking simulator in the style of You play as Henry, an el suffering fr and must navigate a life-threatening home invasion on New Years Eve. Experience me crucial moments series of interspersed vignettes, and use what you learn to uncover the truth and survive the night. 

FEATURES

  • Surreal, non-linear presentation of an unsettling and dreamlike story concerning a man living with regrets 

  • Harrowing original soundtrack and foley inspired by the modal jazz movement of the 1950s and 60s, uncanny demixes of classic folk and Americana samples and idioms, and chilling ambient synth soundscaping

  • Graphical elements reminiscent of late 90s and early 2000s horror titles

  • Heavily stylized dialogue offering clues to piecing together the mysteries of the experience as memories spill into the present day

content_descriptors.notes: This experience includes subject matter that may be sensitive or triggering for some players, including acts of domestic violence, violent acts involving the elderly, depictions of struggles related to mental and physical health, and consumption of legal drugs and alcohol. Pennywhistle Studios has made every effort to meet this sensitive subject matter seriously and at eye level, and to only include depictions of mature content when it is necessary in serving the holistic themes and tone of the experience.
